{"step_by_step_thinking": "The respiratory rhythm generation center is responsible for the basic rhythm of breathing. The Pre-Botzinger complex, located in the medulla oblongata of the brainstem, is believed to be the primary generator of this rhythm. The dorsal and ventral respiratory groups, as well as the pneumotaxic center, are involved in the modulation and fine-tuning of the respiratory rhythm, but they are not the primary generators.", "answer_choice": "B. Pre-Botzinger complex"}
